contentrichtext.text: {{for|the town|Greifensee, Zurich}} {{Infobox lake |lake_name = Greifensee |image_lake = GreifenseeHigh.jpg |caption_lake = View from the surrounding hills |image_bathymetry = |caption_bathymetry = |coords = {{coord|47|21|N|8|41|E|type:waterbody_region:CH-ZH|display=inline,title}} |location = [[Canton of Zurich]] |type = [[eutrophic]] |inflow = [[Ustermer Aa|Aa]], [[Aabach (Greifensee)|Aabach]] |outflow = [[Glatt (river)|Glatt]] |catchment = {{convert|160|km2|sqmi|sp=us}} |basin_countries = [[Switzerland]] |length = {{convert|6|km|mi|abbr=on}} |width = {{convert|1.6|km|mi|abbr=on}} |area = {{convert|8.45|km2|sqmi|sp=us}} |depth = {{convert|18|m|ft|abbr=on}} |max-depth = {{convert|32|m|ft|abbr=on}} |volume = 0.148 km³ |residence_time = 408 days |shore = |elevation = {{convert|435|m|ft|abbr=on}} |islands = |cities = [[Maur, Switzerland|Maur]], [[Uster|Niederuster]], [[Fällanden]], [[Mönchaltorf]] and the town [[Greifensee, Zurich|Greifensee]] }} [[File:Karte Greifensee.png|thumb|upright|245px|Map of Greifensee]] [[File:Greifensee - Maur IMG 2520.JPG|thumb|left|Greifensee as seen from [[Greifensee, Zurich|Greifensee town]], [[Maur, Switzerland|Maur]] and [[Pfannenstiel (Zürich)|Pfannenstiel]] in the background]] [[File:Greifensee - Greifensee ZH.jpg|thumb|left|Greifensee at [[Greifensee, Zurich|Greifensee (ZH)]] harbour]] [[File:Greifensee - DS Greif IMG 2535.jpg|thumb|left|Steamship "Greif" (built in 1895)]] '''Greifensee''' (or "Lake Greifen" meaning [[griffin]]) is a small [[lake]] in the [[canton of Zürich]] in [[Switzerland]]. == Geography == Lake Greifen (German: ''Greifensee'') is located {{convert|11|km|mi|abbr=on}} to the east of the city of [[Zurich]], separated by the [[Pfannenstiel (Zürich)|Pfannenstiel]] from [[Lake Zürich]]. As the second largest lake in the canton of Zurich ([[Lake Zurich]] being the largest), it is about {{convert|6|km|mi|abbr=on}} long and {{convert|1.6|km|mi|abbr=on}} at the widest point, with a maximum depth of {{convert|32|m|ft|abbr=on}}. The [[Aabach (Greifensee)|Aabach]] is the main supplying river. == Points of interest == A boat connects small towns along the edge of the lake, [[Maur, Switzerland|Maur]], [[Uster|Niederuster]], [[Fällanden]], [[Mönchaltorf]] and the town [[Greifensee, Zurich|Greifensee]] with its charming [[Altstadt]] and Greifensee castle. Greifensee is the scene of the [http://www.greifenseelauf.ch Greifensee-Lauf], a semi-[[marathon (sport)|marathon]] around the lake held every year. Greifensee is a popular recreation area for [[biking]] and [[inline skating]] on the paved recreation path around the lake. Easy [[hiking]] trails follow the water and pass Greifensee castle before entering a nature preserve. There are well maintained bicycle roads all around the lake as well as on the banks of Aabach. == Nature == The lakeside is under UNESCO [[Environmental protection|protection]], and buildings are not allowed, resulting in [[reed bed]] and a rich [[fauna]] and [[flora]]: Around 400 plant species in the lake and 19 species in its tributaries. The nature reserves are important for the birds breeding there including more than 120 migratory species. == References == {{reflist}} == External links == {{commonscat-inline}} * {{HDS|8650|Greifensee (lake)}} * [http://www.sgg-greifensee.ch Schifffahrts-Genossenschaft Greifensee: Boat schedules] {{de icon}} * [http://www.hydrodaten.admin.ch/en/2082.html#aktuelle_daten Waterlevels] at [[Greifensee, Zurich|Greifensee]] [[Category:Lakes of Switzerland]] [[Category:Lakes of the canton of Zurich]] [[Category:High Rhine basin]]
